pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:0.5: 24. The second training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their upper robes covering their heads. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.3: “‘I will not sit with my head covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.4: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not cover the head.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his upper robe covering his head, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk24:1.15: The fourth training rule is finished.
